name: E. 7.2 - Pediatric HIV care and treatment intake
encounter: Pediatric HIV care and treatment intake

questions.label: Feeding pattern in the first 6 months of life

answers.label: Recurrent or chronic Bacterial URTIs (Sinusitis, Otitis Media, Ottorhea, Tonsillitis)
Chronic herpes simplex virus infection (orolabial or visceral)
Acute necrotizing Ulcerative gingivitis or periodontitis
Extra pulmonary TB except Lymph node TB
Chronic herpes simplex virus infection (orolabial, genital or anorectal)
Recurrent Bacterial URTIs (Sinusitis, Otitis Media, Tonsillopharyngitis )
Severe Bacterial Infections (Pneumonia, Septic arthritis, osteomyelitis, Pyomyositis, PID)
Ear pain, discharge or decreased hearing
Rheumatoid Arthritis, Joint Pain or Joint Swelling Today

questions.label: Weight loss/Failure to thrive(% of body weight)

alert.message: Pulse Rate is out of range (Normal range 60-100)
Respiratory Rate is out of range (Normal range 12-16)

validators.message: Temperature should not be less than 32 or more than 40
CD4 Count should not be less than 0
CD4% should not be less than 0 or above 100%

answers.label: Recurrent  or chronic upper respiratory  tract infection(otitis media, ottorhea, sinusitis or tonsillitis)
Recurrent oral ulcerations (two or more episodes in last 6 months)
Acute necrotizing ulcerative stomatitis, gingivitis or periodontitis
Chronic HIV-associated lung disease  including  brnchiectasis
persistent oral candidiasis(after 6-8 weks of life)
unexplained moderate malnutrition or wasting not adequately  responding to standard therapy
unexplained persistent diarrhea(14 days or more)
Unexplained anemia(<8d/dl), neutropenia(<0.5 *10^9 per liter), and or chronic thrombocytopenia(<50 * 10^9)
Unexplained persistent fever (intermittent or constant and lasting for longer than 1 month)
Chronic herpes simplex virus (HSV) infection (orolabial, genital or anorectal) > 1 month
cerebral  or B-cell non- Hodgkin lymphoma
central nervous system toxoplasmosis(after one month of life)
recurrent severe bacterial infections(such as  empyema, pyomyositis, bone or  joint infection  or meningitis  but excluding  pneumonia)

description: Pediatric hiv care and treatment intake form
